resources.string: This permission is required for and used only for applying Screen Lock from Yantra Launcher.
Auto Execute command when Secondary Suggestion is Selected
Enter a prefix for your username. This will be displayed before your username in the terminal.
Enter a command to be executed when you double tap the terminal.
Enter a command to be executed when you swipe right on the terminal.
Enter a command to be executed when you swipe left on the terminal.
Enter a website URL to be opened when you enter the \"news\" command.
Enter a font size for the terminal:
Enter a size for the terminal Arrow Keys:
Enter the path to the directory where the Termux command is located.
Enter the path to the directory where the Termux command will be executed.
Enter integer for Termux Session Action. Available : 0,1,2,3. See TermuxConstants.java on GitHub for more info.
Enter your AI provider\'s domain for use in the \'ai\' command. Do not provide the entire URL, just the domain is required (For example: api.openai.com
AI API Provider updated! Make sure you use the corresponding API Key
Enter your API Key for use in the \'ai\' command, corresponding to your AI provider.
Enter The \'system\' prompt for use in the \'ai\' command. It dictates the behaviour of the model.
An error occurred. Please try again.

You need to purchase Font Pack to access this setting.

Font Pack is an add-on for Yantra Launcher that lets you use any font from the entire collection of Google Fonts of more than 1550 fonts for your Yantra Launcher Terminal.

You can purchase Font Pack using the 'fontpack' command.
Error Downloading Font! Please check you internet connection and try again.
echo Right Swipe detected! You can change the command in settings.
echo Left Swipe detected! You can change the command in settings.
An error occurred while fetching apps list
" Contacts not yet fetched! Use 'list contacts' command to fetch contacts first to get suggestions. "
Contact name not found! Attempting to parse as phone number...
Multiple Phone numbers with the name `%1$s` were found. Which one do you want to call?
A new version of Yantra Launcher is available on the Play Store.
If you like this app, please consider rating it and giving a feedback. You can also request features or report bugs. It helps me in improving the app. Thanks :)

Join the community to get the latest updates about Yantra Launcher, ask questions, get help, discuss new features, and more!\n\nEveryone out there are CLI enthusiastsüòé like you, so join the community and have fun!
Sorry, Yantra Launcher seems to have crashed! Please send a report to the developer to help debug the crash. Pressing Ok will take yo to your email client.
You can add an optional comment here to describe the crash:

A simple tool to access chatGPT from the terminal. Based on OpenAI\'s gpt-3.5-turbo, you can chat with your own AI assistant. An API key is required to be entered in \'settings\'. This command does not remember context, so the model will be unaware of your previous conversation.
Please specify the message to send to AI.
You probably forgot to provide an API key. Please enter it in \'settings\'.
No reply found in the response
The server did not send a chat reply! Try again.
I lost my patience! Try again or try a request with a shorter expected output.
Authentication Failed. Make sure you used the correct API key in \'settings\'

Sets alarm using a supported Alarm Clock on your device. Use without args to open the list of alarms on your device default app. The time must be in 24 hr format. It can optionally be followed by a message string to display in alarm.
Examples:
'alarm 14:30' sets alarm for 2:30 pm
'alarm 0:15 Wish good night to ***' sets alarm for 12:15 am with a message to display.
No time provided. Launching alarm app.
Invalid time string provided. It must confront to hh:mm format and must be in 24 hr representation.
No supported alarm app found on your device.

Unix-like aliasing system to set short-hand commands for available commands. Note that Yantra Launcher saves all aliases in memory and is retained even after restarting the Launcher session. Pre-defined commands can not be aliased.
Usage (to set or update an alias): 'alias alias_name = alias_cmd'
Example: 'alias h = help'
Use 'alias alias_name' to get value of the alias. Use 'alias' to get list of all current aliases. Use 'alias -1' to reset to default aliases.
Invalid command. Use \'alias\' to get list of aliases.
Invalid command. See \'help alias\' for usage info
Alias name cannot be an existing command name.
Alias name must contain only alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter
Shows current Battery Level. Use the optional \'-bar\' argument to show just the battery percentage and charging status in visual form.
Invalid args provided. See \"help battery\" for usage info

\'bg\' is used to set custom Wallpaper from the Albums. Use \'bg -1\' to remove custom Wallpaper and set to solid theme background. Use \'bg random\' to fetch a random Wallpaper from the Internet. An optional [query] can be specified with the random command, like \'bg random mountains\' or \'bg random texture,dark\' to fetch related Wallpaper. Note that this command only changes the Home screen wallpaper, not the Lock screen one.
Too many arguments. Use \'bg -1\' to remove custom Wallpaper
Too many arguments. Use \',\' to separate topics like \'bg random city,night-life\'
Toggles bluetooth on/off. Example: \'bluetooth on\' or \'bt 0\'
Please specify a state for bluetooth
Toggle state not recognized. Try using \'on\' | \'off\' or 0 | 1.
This feature requires Android 6 or higher
Helps you find things to do when you\'re bored! (using Bored API)
\'bored\' command does not take any parameters

An in-built calculator to evaluate arithmetic expressions. It does addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, exponentiation (using the ^ symbol), and a few basic functions like sqrt, sin, cos and tan. It supports grouping using (...), and it gets the operator precedence and associativity rules correct.\n\nExample: \'calc ((4 - 2^3 + 1) * -sqrt(3*3+4*4)) / 2\' gives 7.5
Please specify an expression to evaluate.
Calls specified contact name. If contact name is not found then the raw input (considered as phone number) is called.
Please specify a contact name or phone number to call
Changes the current directory to the specified path.\nExample: \'cd DCIM\'
\'%1$s\' command does not take any parameters.

In case you want any new commands to be added to Yantra Launcher, run this command to open email template for command request. Note that it is not guaranteed that the command request will be accepted but I\'ll try my best to see if I could accommodate it in the upcoming versions of Yantra Launcher, if suitable.
\'cmdrequest\' command does not take any parameters.
Could not launch an email app. Please send the mail to coderGtm@gmail.com with title \'%1$s\'
Redirects the Discord server of Yantra Launcher. Here you can share and get Feedback, Suggestions, Insights, tips and CLI emotions from other users like you!
\'community\' command does not take any parameters.
Search for the meaning of a word in an online dictionary (freeDictionaryAPI)
Please specify the word to search for.
No internet connection! This command relies on an online Dictionary API, so an internet connection is required to access it.

Prints specified text to the terminal with the given mode. Here mode is an optional argument (e: Error text, s: Success text, w: Warning text) representing the nature of the text output. If mode is not specified, the text is printed (normal)ly
Examples:
'echo -e An error occurred.'
'echo Hello, World'
Invalid Syntax. See \'help echo\' for usage info.
Launches email app with recipient set. Example: \'email coderGtm@gmail.com\'
Could not launch an email app.
Sorry pal, we couldn\'t find definitions for the word you were looking for.
Exit Launcher. Note: Launcher will restart if set as default Launcher
\'exit\' command does not take any parameters.
Please provide your valuable feedback and any features you want in the next release of the app. Consider giving a 5 star review on the Play Store if you like the app.
\'%1$s\' command does not take any parameters.

Thank you for choosing to give feedback! Your feedback fuels my motivation and helps me improve the app.\n\nYou can send feedback my mailing me at coderGtm@gmail.com or by giving a review on the Play Store.
Toggles flashlight on/off. Example: \'flash on\' or \'flash 0\'. Use without any args to toggle the state.

G.U.P.T stands for Get Undercover Private Tab. Tired of going to browser everytime and opening Incognito Tab. With GUPT command, you get a built-in Private incognito Tab. Example: \'gupt https://www.youtube.com\'. Use without url to default to https://www.google.com
Documentation/Manual for all commands of Yantra Launcher. Use \'help cmd_name\' to get documentation for specific command.
Command not found. Use \'help\' to get list of available commands.
Invalid command usage. See \'help\' for usage info
Launches app settings page for specified app. Example: \'info Big Battery Display\' or \'i Farty Orbit\'
Multiple entries found for\'%1$s\'. Opening selection dialog.
Multiple apps found with name \'%1$s\'. Please select one.
\'%1$s\' app not found. Try using \'list apps\' to get list of all app names.
Failed to launch app info page :(
Launches app settings by matching given app name string using fuzzy search algorithm (Levenshtein distance). Example: \'openf tube\' may open system settings for YouTube.
Please give a string to launch app settings with fuzzy search.
A special script (function) to execute specified commands automatically whenever Launcher is opened or navigated to.
Opening Initialization Tasks for Yantra Launcher

Enter commands one-per-line to execute when Yantra Launcher gets in focus (opened or navigated-back to).\n\nWARNING: This is a powerful feature. Please be careful while using it. Using commands like \'reset\' in this script can cause the launcher to recursively restart infinitely. Hence, it is recommended to use this feature only if you know what you are doing.
Opens a panel containing settings to enable internet connection.
Uh oh! I am sorry but it\'s time to upgrade to Android 10 at least to use this command :(
Please specify an app to launch.
Launches app by matching given app name string using fuzzy search algorithm (Levenshtein distance). Example: \'launchf tube\' may launch YouTube.
Please give a string to launch app with fuzzy search.
Invalid command. See \'help list\' for usage info
%1$s is not a recognized parameter. Try using \'apps\'.
Applies Screen Lock to your Yantra (device). Note: Appropriate permissions are required.
Please turn on Accessibility Service for Yantra Launcher for \'lock\' command to work.

Please enable device administrator for Yantra Launcher for Lock command to work.\n\nNote that for Android 8 and below, using lock from Yantra Launcher may prevent Biometric Authentication and use only PIN or Password for the next time you unlock your Device, due to Android API limitations.
Lists contents in the current directory. Optionally, pass the \'-a\' flag to also show hidden files/folders.
Error! Invalid argument provided. \'ls\' command accepts only 1 flag parameter: \'-a\'.
Error! \'ls\' command accepts only 1 flag parameter: \'-a\'.
Opens the news website configured via settings. Defaults to Google News
Could not open the news website. Please check the URL in settings.
Fire a notification with the given message.\nExample: notify Opened work apps
Please specify the message to fire the notification.
Select a Language for your Yantra Launcher

Yantra Launcher is committed to present itself in various locales! Note that translations of Yantra Launcher are done by volunteers and may have some discrepancies in them. If you find any, please report them by opening an issue on the GitHub repository of Yantra Launcher so volunteers can fix them. Always check out the English version for any clarification!\n\nAlso, if you want to translate Yantra Launcher into your language, please open an issue on the GitHub repository of Yantra Launcher.
Please specify a file to open.
Displays a random quote! What else do you expect?
Used to run your custom scripts.
Please specify a script name to run.
\'run\' command takes only 1 parameter: The script name to run.
Script \'%1$s\' is not defined. Use \'scripts\' command to create your own Yantra Scripts.

Shows Total Screen time for the day! Give app name to get screen time for particular app, or use the \'-all\' flag to get screentime for all apps used today.\nExample: \'screentime Instagram\' or \'screentime -all\'
Please grant the \'Usage Access\' permission to Yantra Launcher to access the required data for screen time.
Ouch! Screen Time is not supported on this device. Minimum Android 5.1 is required! :(
Opens dialog for creating, modifying and deleting custom scripts for Yantra Launcher, to execute multiple commands at once. Also see the \'run\' command.
View, Edit or Delete this script. Note: Enter 1 command per line, just as you normally enter in the Yantra terminal.
No Scripts found! Try creating one.
Script name cannot contain \';\' or be empty.
Script name must start with a letter and cannot contain any spaces
Script \'%1$s\' created successfully! You can now edit it.

Searches the internet for the provided query. Search engine can be specified with the -e flag (-e=google|duckduckgo|brave|bing|yahoo|ecosia|startpage|qwant|you|playstore). Default is google. You can use a custom search engine by specifying the url with the -u flag (-u=https://example.com/search?q=). The query is the only required argument that is provided at the end of the command. It is automatically URL encoded during execution of the command. Examples:
'search Yantra Launcher'
'search -e=duckduckgo Yantra Launcher'
'search -u=https://example.com/search?q= Yantra Launcher'
Invalid search engine. See \'help search\' to get info about search engine keywords.
Searching for \'%1$s\' with custom search engine...
No app found to open the URL.
An error occurred while opening the URL.
Pauses Yantra Launcher for specified milliseconds.\nUsage: \'sleep numOfMilliseconds\'\nExample: \'sleep 5000\'
Please specify sleep duration in milliseconds.
\'sleep\' command takes only 1 parameter: sleep duration in milliseconds.
Opens a small GUI speedtest utility to check your internet speed, powered by openspeedtest.com.
\'support\' command does not take any **arguments**. _It\'s a friendly command... :)_

Yantra Launcher is a powerful and free open-source tool to boost your productivity and be cool. Developing this launcher and maintaining it genuinely demands a lot of efforts, resources and invaluable time. If Yantra Launcher has made any positive difference in your life, I appeal you to check ou the Support section on the project\'s GitHub page.

\nRemember, Yantra Launcher is completely free and open-source. You can support the developer by contributing to the project, reporting issues, suggesting features, and sharing it with your friends and family.
:: Redirecting you to the Support section on the project\'s GitHub page...

Runs given command in termux if it is installed. Note that the 'allow-external-apps' property must be set to true in ~/.termux/termux.properties in Termux app and RUN_COMMAND permission must be given from Yantra Launcher's settings page. Also, termux session is closed as soon as command is terminated due to API restrictions.
Usage: termux cmd_name [args]
Example: 'termux top -n 5
To resolve any issues still occurring, ask in Discord Community or mail me at coderGtm@gmail.com.
Invalid command. See \'help termux\' for usage info
You need to grant the Termux Run Command Permission to Yantra Launcher for this command to work!
Could not run command in Termux. Error: %1$s
Broadcasts text message. Example: \'text Yantra is cool!\'
Applies specified theme to Yantra Launcher. Example: \'theme Tokyonight\'
Invalid command usage. \'theme\' command takes a single parameter: the theme name!
%1$s is not a theme I know of! Please use \'list themes\' to get the list of themes.

Shows current local Date and Time. Use the utc arg to get UTC time. An optional time difference parameter can add or subtract that from UTC time. Example:
time
time utc
time utc +5:30
Invalid parameter provided. See \'help time\' for usage info.
Invalid time difference provided. Please provide a correct parameter. Refer \'help time\' for usage info.

Used to create a countdown timer using the default app on your device. Use without args to launch the timer app. The length must be in seconds and ranges from 1 to 86400 (24 hrs). It can optionally be followed by a message string to display in timer.
Examples:
'timer 60' sets timer for 1 minute
'timer 3600 Take out the trash' sets timer for 1 hour with a message to display.
No length provided. Launching timer app.
Invalid length string provided. It must be a number between 1 and 86400.
No supported timer app found on your device.

A simple TODO utility. Use \'todo\' to get list of tasks with their indexes and progress. Add a task like \'todo Go for a brisk walk\'. Mark tasks as done using their index returned from \'todo\' command, like \'todo 2\' marks the 3rd task as done. Use \'todo -1\' to clear list.\n\nUse the -p argument to mark optional progress for any task, like \'todo -p 1 30\' marks the 2nd task as 30% done (Syntax: todo -p taskIndex progress). Use \'todo -p -1\' to reset progress for all tasks.
Try adding an item like: todo Finish Game server config
TODO List index out of range. Try a number less than %1$d.
Invalid index provided. Use index of -1 to clear the list.
Invalid command usage. Use \'todo -p -1\' to reset progress for all tasks.
Invalid progress value. Use a value from 0 to 100.
Item already present in todo list
Translator based on Google Translate. Provide a valid language code flag and the text to translate. The source language is automatically detected. Example:\n translate -fr Hello
Please provide the language code flag and the text to translate.
Language code not found. Please provide a valid language code.
Speaks provided text (Text-to-Speech). Example: \'tts Travel, World!\'

Used to un-alias (remove) an alias.
Usage: 'unalias alias_name'
Example: 'unalias h'
Use 'unalias -1' to remove all aliases
Invalid command. Use \'unalias alias_name\' to remove alias
Invalid command. See \'help unalias\' to get usage info.
Uninstalls the specified app. Example: \'u Instagram\'
Used to change username. Example: username johnDoe
Vibrates the device for specified duration (in milliseconds).\nExample: \'vibe 1000\' does a 1 second vibration.
Please specify vibration duration in milliseconds.
Invalid usage. \'vibe\' command takes only 1 argument: time to vibrate in milliseconds.
Hold on wiz! How can your device vibrate in negative time? Only positive values allowed!
You want to vibrate for 0 milliseconds? Really?
Fetches the weather report for specified location. Example w new delhi
Opens the specified URL in your browser, if present, ofc!
Please specify the URL to open.
You would need a web browser to open this URL, which I couldn\'t find on your device :|
TIP: If you don\'t want to install a full-fledged web browser, you can use the \'gupt\' command to open the URL in a private browsing session, built into Yantra Launcher.
Something went wrong while opening the URL :(
